argument.description: An expression that returns a value of one of the following built-in data types: a DATE, TIMESTAMP, or a valid character string representation of a date or timestamp that is not a CLOB.

description: The DAYS function returns an integer representation of a date.
sample:
SELECT DAYS(PRENDATE) - DAYS(PRSTDATE)
     INTO :EDUCATION_DAYS
     FROM PROJECT
     WHERE PROJNO = 'IF2000'
